what: playjareyesores | an R package for detecting plagiarism
title: Various Musings
text: 2019-06-20, last compiled: 2022-05-17 Plagiarism, happens. ’ve run one occasion, students faculty! Needless say, really urks . university provides access plagiarism detection services like Turnitin Safeassign, however tools can cumbersome use. example, 100 students turn 100 papers, might hope scores programs help identify papers . don’t. example, might get paper says 90% , check , see two students copied assignment instructions paper, making documents similar. might get 5% , check , see although paper doesn’t appear copied, one whole paragraph ’s identical… solve particular comparison problems also sometimes resorted using R plagiarism detection. , thought begin put code package ’m calling playjareyesores: package website: https://crumplab.github.io/playjareyesores/ github repo: https://github.com/CrumpLab/playjareyesores

title: Books and OERs
text: Description: free, open-educational textbook set course materials introductory undergraduate course cognition. materials yet complete, continuing develop across Fall 2021 Spring 2022 semesters. materials CC -SA 4.0 creative-commons licensed free others use, copy, remix, re-use. Written Rmarkdown, compiled bookdown package. source code located github repository https://github.com/CrumpLab/cognition  CITATION TBD PROJECT DEVELOPMENT. Crump, M. J. C. (2022, April 21). Instances Cognition: Questions, Methods, Findings, Explanations, Applications, Implications.

what: Reproducible statistics for psychologists with R: Lab Tutorials
title: Books and OERs
text: Description: series labs/tutorials currently development (2020-2021) two-semester graduate-level statistics sequence Psychology @ Brooklyn College CUNY. first set 13 labs roughly tracks “Thinking Data” (Vokey & Allen, 2018) “Answering questions data” (Crump et al., 2018); second set labs (written weekly basis Spring 2021 semester) roughly track “Experimental Design Analysis Psychology” (Abdi et al., 2009). Written Rmarkdown, compiled bookdown package. source code located github repository https://github.com/CrumpLab/rstatsforpsych  Citation: Crump, M. J. C. (2020, December 10). Reproducible statistics psychologists R: Lab Tutorials. https://doi.org/10.17605/OSF.IO/KBHGA

what: Using R for Reproducible Research: Student contributed tutorials
title: Books and OERs
text: Description: chapters written students PSYC 7709: Using R Reproducible research, Spring 2019 @ Brooklyn College CUNY, part final project write tutorial R package. Written Rmarkdown, compiled bookdown package. source code located github repository https://github.com/CrumpLab/psyc7709_2019  Citation: Abdelrahman, K., Contreras, ., Degtyarev, Z., Deng, J., Foster, J., Franz, ., Funderburk, T., Horger, M., Kravitz, J., Lakshin ., Manigat, M., Trois, R., Vasquez, ., Vo, ., Wilson, N., Yeremenko, M. (2019). Using R Reproducible Research: Student Contributed Tutorials. (M. J. C. Crump, Ed.).

what: Answering Questions with Data: Introductory Statistics for Psychology Students
title: Books and OERs
text: Authors: Matthew Crump; Chapters 2 4 adapted Navarro, D.; Videos: Jeffrey Suzuki Description: free introductory statistics textbook undergraduates Psychology. developed Open Educational Resource @ Brooklyn College. pitched concepts behind statistics, often uses simulation R convey foundational ideas. writing style sometimes bit unconventional, informal. students don’t want like statistics. Written Rmarkdown, compiled bookdown package. source code located github repository https://github.com/CrumpLab/statistics  Citation: Crump, M. J. C., Navarro, D., & Suzuki, J. (2019, June 5). Answering Questions Data (Textbook): Introductory Statistics Psychology Students. https://doi.org/10.17605/OSF.IO/JZE52

what: Answering Questions with Data: The Lab Manual
title: Books and OERs
text: Lab activities using R, Excel, SPSS, JAMOVI Authors: Matthew Crump (R); Stephen Volz (Excel); Alla Chavarga (SPSS); Anjali Krishnan (JAMOVI) Description: companion lab manual free stats book. contains lab activities learning conduct statistical tests R, Excel, SPSS, JAMOVI. use open data, often psychology papers, show step--step solve data-analysis problems software package. labs adapated Open Stats Lab, another great resource. Source code: Written Rmarkdown, compiled bookdown package. source code located github repository https://github.com/CrumpLab/statisticsLab.  Citation: Crump, M. J. C., Krishnan, ., Volz, S., & Chavarga, . (2019, June 5). Answering Questions Data: Lab Manual R, Excel, SPSS Jamovi. https://doi.org/10.17605/OSF.IO/M2NPJ

title: Join
text: Students interested pursuing Ph.D. apply Cognitive Comparative Psychology (CCP) training area Psychology Doctoral Program Graduate Center CUNY. deadline applications December 1st, 2020. can apply directly . Interested applicants also email Matt Crump (mcrump@brooklyn.cuny.edu) introduce research interests.

what: Research experience for Brooklyn College students
title: Join
text: always looking students (undergraduate master’s) interested human cognition (people think, learn, remember, attend, etc.), want gain research experience learning computational techniques running experiments analyzing data. students interested joining lab first complete entry assignment, consists writing short computer program. entry assignment takes little bit time effort. Research takes lot time effort, completing assignment show us motivated spend time research. important, assignment help decide enjoy working research problems lab. enjoy process completing assignment, think look forward working research problems lab. also read lab publications see interested research questions asking.

previous_headings: Research experience for Brooklyn College students
what: Course credit for Research and Honor’s Theses
title: Join
text: students join lab enroll research classes receive course credit gain research experience lab. interested taking one courses, please complete entry assignment , email Dr. Crump availability. classes include: Psych 2001-4 Laboratory Experience (3 credits ) Psych 5001-4 Independent Research (3 credits ) Laboratory Experience courses intended students new research, Independent Research courses senior students. one semester long, involve conducting research lab writing research report final project. Several students completed honor’s theses lab (see departmental requirements). honor’s thesis consists two semesters Independent Research (e.g., Psych 5001 5002) culminates writing thesis covering research conducted year. honor’s thesis option great opportunity students interested pursuing research Ph.D. program following undergraduate studies. honor’s thesis major commitment time effort everyone involved, students complete honor’s theses lab usually already members lab previous research experience lab (e.g., taken Psyc 2001 Dr. Crump). , interested research plan get involved early possible.

previous_headings: Research experience for Brooklyn College students
title: Join
text: Recent undergraduate research projects completed lab. 2022: Patrick Ihejirika, “Try forget image: role stimulus duration directed forgetting natural scenes”, Undergraduate MARC Honors thesis, Barry Goldwater Scholar 2019: Mark Rayev, “Deception detection word usage word production time typing”, Undergraduate Macaulay Honors 2018: Walter Lai, Contributing author “Instance theory predicts information theory: Episodic uncertainty determinant keystroke dynamics”, currently completing Masters Data Science Southern Methodist University

title: Join
text: ’re interested becoming part lab (volunteering, taking course etc.), first thing complete entry assignment. assignment consists writing small computer program (previous programming experience necessary, invitation start learning programming skills).

what: Why are we asking you to do this?
title: Join
text: lot activities lab involve computer programming: experiments, timing, stimulus presentation key press registration controlled programs write . analyze data experiments, programs, written us, take raw data, calculate things averages, display results graphs, perform statistical tests. assignment allows demonstrate interest type activity, investing time assignment can show commitment becoming part lab.

title: Join
text: assignment. following steps make website, attempt solve problem R. sounds complicated, everything need get started right , following steps: Download R R-studio computer. Make github account. General info making websites R Markdown , see next point downloading example can use straight away. https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/rmarkdown_websites.htm Follow steps get started: repository https://github.com/CrumpLab/LabJournalWebsite Follow instructions read file compile website R-studio, host github can see website look like get runnning https://crumplab.github.io/LabJournalWebsite/index.html Follow instructions inside source website, reading website get started learning R. example, example website, can read journal page, explains process. see example problems solve R, link problems solve. solved first three, assignment attempt solve one problem. Assuming got everything running, can send email (mcrump@brooklyn.cuny.edu) introducing . Link website made, tell little bit want join lab ’ll set meeting. Email R-script Dr. Crump (mcrump@brooklyn.cuny.edu) request time meet gaining research experience lab.

title: Blogging with pkgdown
text: need make decisions . put individual vignettes blog folder, make subdirectories post. naming conventions? kind structure might work. , need check posts rendered articles page.

title: Blogging with pkgdown
text: pkgdown::build_articles() compile .Rmds vignettes folder. blog posts , compiled . function also creates index.html knitted vignettes. plan use page list blog posts, pages vignettes folder. can accomplished _pkgdown.yml. example, following creates sections index.html, uses starts_with() loop folders start post blog folder.
code: articles: - title: Newer Posts   desc: Trying out blogging with pkgdown.   navbar: ~   contents:   - starts_with("blog/post") - title: Older Posts   desc: Need to add links to older stuff here...   navbar: ~

what: Ordering posts from newest to oldest
title: Blogging with pkgdown
text: adopt naming convention post_M_D_Y_title, posts get listed oldest newest index page. Need flip . seems like just need sort order posts somehow, couldn’t figure . use naming convention number gets smaller every new post post_number_M_D_Y_title. ’s mildly annoying, probably now. Another option override _pkgdown.yml running build_articles(). require writing alternative yml lists contents preferred order. seems like much work.

title: Website for CrumpLab
text: Computational Cognition Lab Brooklyn College CUNY investigates learning, memory, attention, performance, semantic cognition. ask questions like people learn new skills playing instrument typing keyboard? memory work? people learn meaning words? people learn patterns regularities environment? kinds questions investigated using behavioral experiments computational modeling cognitive processes. lab also uses variety computational methods tools conduct communicate research. Current previous lab members include undergraduate, master’s , doctoral, postdoctoral researcher associates. interested human cognition using computational techniques theorizing, running experiments, analyzing data, developing new technologies may interested joining team. lab located Department Psychology Brooklyn College CUNY, affiliated Cognitive Comparative Psychology Training area Psychology Doctoral program Graduate Center CUNY.
